newsitem.title: DENMARK: Becalmed Danish shares consolidate ahead of Buba.
newsitem.headline: Becalmed Danish shares consolidate ahead of Buba.

text.p: Danish share prices closed lower on Wednesday, taking a breather to consolidate on top of five days of record highs, with dealers seeing Thursday's Bundesbank council meeting and a possible German repo rate cut shaping trade in the days ahead.
"The stock market will stay within a quarter point range ahead of the first Buba meeting after the summer break with a German repo rate very much on the cards," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index closed 0.73 point down at 119.86 while the KFX September future fell 0.25 point to 120.25 with 80 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
KFX paper suffered across the board losses while lesser shares swept up in the wake of the ongoing stream of 1996 first-half results.
NKT put on four percent to close at 305 crowns on its decision to stop unprofitable production of motors for its troubled Nilfisk vacuum cleaner manufacturing unit.
Unidanmark bank shod seven crowns to 265 after a good 1996 interim result, while the biggest bank Den Danske finished unchanged at 396 on the eve of its first-half 1996 result.
Overall turnover for the day was 593 million crowns.
